events.name: Why Google Cloud Platform? Why now? Let's get started!
events.description:
✨ Dear Everyone! We are happy to kick-off our new community dedicated to Google Cloud Platform! ✨

We start at 18:30, doors will opened at 18:00.

For the first event, we have the opportunity to have 2 wonderful speakers from Google Poland: Kasia and Michal!

Why Google Cloud Platform? Why now? (30 min) - Kasia Bednarowicz
Let's dive together into the Google Cloud world! I will provide a helicopter view of the GCP from the industry and Google perspective? Why it is important and what are the key workflows across different industries? This session will be a perfect opening before you move on to a more technical conversation with Michał.

Google Cloud Platform - let me get you started! (60 min) - Michal Żyliński
It doesn't matter if you're cloud newbie or claim to proficient with other cloud vendors - getting started with GCP can and should be straightforward and painless process. During this session I'll try to give you the motivation to get started. I'll discuss the commonalities in cloud world and what features make GCP unique in the market, give you guidance on how to structure your learning experience and share a few tips and tricks on how to use GCP as a pro (maybe even earning formal certificate :)).

A short bio of our speakers:

Kasia is a Google Cloud Sales Manager in CEE helping direct clients and partners to build optimal solutions with Google Cloud. Kasia has multiple years of international experience in Digital Marketing and Big Data Platforms. She has been a trusted advisor to Google strategic partners around optimal tech stack solutions for programmatic buying and selling (Google Marketing Platform - GMP), enabling personalization and optimal multi-screen advertising strategy powered by big data. Prior to her role in Warsaw at Google Cloud, she used to work for Google in New York and Hamburg (Germany).

Michał is a solution architect in Google, helping customers and partners utilize cloud to its fullest potential. He's a true passionate about the impact of information on business and social processes and used to work as a consultant on many projects related to big data, machine learning and data science.

-----------------------------------------
The event will be held at Tóth Kálmán u. 2., Conference Room B0-38.
Drinks & snacks & coffee will be provided.
events.how_to_find_us: IT Services Hungary Kft, Tóth Kálmán street 2b. The venue can be found on the ground floor, next to the reception.

events.name: Google Cloud & IoT meetup with Gus Class from Google, Moutain View, CA, USA
events.description:
Dear Everyone!

✨ We are happy to announce the first joint meetup organized by GDG Budapest & GDG Cloud Budapest together. ✨

This is going to be a pre-DevFest event, where we will host Gus Class, Staff Developer Programs Engineer at Google, USA.

Gus works on IoT at Google and previously contributed to Google+, Cardboard, Tango, Games, and Identity products at Google. He worked on the tablet and touch features of Microsoft Windows in a previous life.

We will start at 18:30, doors will be opened at 18:00.

### Agenda ###

- Welcome by the organizers
- DevFest Budapest conference - Zsigmond P.Toth
- Machine Learning from IoT Class devices.... without a PhD - Gus Class
- Break & Networking
- IoT Study Jam - Hands-on labs
- Networking

### Details of the presentations ###

Machine Learning from IoT Class devices.... without a PhD
Speaker: Gus Class, Google, USA

In this talk, you will learn how to collect images from IoT-class devices and classify the image data on Google Cloud using the Machine Learning API.
We'll start by connecting a device to Google Cloud using IoT Core, will show you how to classify images of a switch using the Vision API, and will store the classifications in Cloud SQL.
At the conclusion of the talk you will have a starting point for using Machine Learning from IoT-class devices to warehouse classified data.

DevFest Budapest conference
Speaker: Zsigmond P.Toth, GDG Budapest, DevFest Budapest organizer, Consultant at Enoventum Labs

In this talk you will learn about the DevFest conference series and details of the upcoming DevFest Budapest event.

IoT Study Jam - Hands-on labs
Labs will be led by Gus Class with assistance of local experts

Together we'll work through a couple of Google Cloud IoT labs provided by Qwiklabs.
You will get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge.
Then after our live session, you will have 1 month free access to the Qwiklabs platform where you can complete additional labs.
By completing Qwiklabs hands-on labs you will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console, Kubernetes, Security, IoT on Cloud, and Machine Learning.
If you continue your quest at home and you do well, you will get a 2nd free month of Qwiklabs.

------------------------------------------------
The event will be held at IT Services Hungary, Tóth Kálmán u. 2., Conference Room B0-38.
Drinks & snacks & coffee will be provided.

events.name: Google's data platform portfolio - Where and How to Store Your Stuff
events.description:
✨ Dear Everyone! We are happy to announce the last GDG Cloud Budapest event of 2019! ✨

We start at 18:30, doors will be opened at 18:00.

This time, our data will be in the main focus!

##Agenda ##
- Welcome, introduction
- Getting Google Cloud Certified!
- GCP Databases: Where and How to Store Your Stuff
- Networking

## Details ##
Getting Google Cloud Certified!
Speakers: Zoltán Katona, Kristóf Helmrich
Are you looking for the best way to prepare yourself for the Google Cloud certification? The presenters recently became Google Cloud certified and they will provide you valuable insights from firsthand experience regarding the Professional Cloud Architect, and the Professional Data Engineer certifications.

GCP Databases: Where and How to Store Your Stuff
Speaker: Michal Zylinski
Interested in understanding Google's data platform portfolio? Are you considering the migration of your transactional system to the cloud? During this session, Michal will cover most of the ways to keep your data secure, at scale and ready for action using (sort of) real-world use case.

-------------------
The event will be held at IT Services Hungary, Tóth Kálmán u. 2., Conference Room B0-38.
Drinks & snacks & coffee will be provided.

events.name: Let's talk about Google's BI, AI and Security solutions!
events.description:
✨ Dear Everyone! We are happy to announce the first GDG Cloud Budapest event of 2020, where BI, AI and security will be in focus! ✨

We start at 18:00, doors will be opened at 17:30.

##Agenda ##

- Welcome, introduction
- How to build BI stack on Google Cloud?
- Google AI - is it something for me?
- Security of Google Cloud
- Networking

## Details ##

Session1: How to build BI stack on Google Cloud?
Speakers: DXC’s Google Certified Cloud Architects
Would you like to see Google Cloud’s data services in action? The presenters will lead you through the process of building a pilot data warehouse from scratch and show you how to use pre-trained machine learning models in the cloud to get business value out of your data as quickly as possible. In order to have more fun the team will introduce a number of demonstrations regarding Cloud Dataflow, Data Fusion, Pub/Sub, BigQuery, Data Studio and Looker throughout the presentations.

Session2: Google AI - is it something for me?
Speaker: Michal Zylinski
During last session we covered multiple ways to keep your data safe and available. Now it is time to use it for something more spectacular than single queries. I'll try to get you acquainted with basic AI vocabulary and give you a clear roadmap of currently available AI and ML services.

Session3: Security of Google Cloud
Speaker: Pavel Krejsa
Title: Security of your data in Google Cloud
Description: How Google takes care about your data, so they are stored and processed securely. We will cover details about the entire stack from HW to SW, encryption, access management, threat detection and response. We will cover a bit of GDPR topic too.

-------------------
The event will be held at IT Services Hungary, Tóth Kálmán u. 2., Conference Room B0-38.
Drinks & snacks & coffee will be provided.
